concept-wr.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Extensions to Heat
concept-wr.shortdesc: Several extensions to Heat are included with HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

conbody.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Extensions are supported only for OpenStack resources, which are the primary resources used with HOT format.

section.title: Multiple NIC Support
section.p: When launching a VM instance initially or in an autoscaling stack, you can specify multiple network interfaces. The open-source version of Heat allows only a single network interface to be specified at launch.

section.title: Simplified VM Instance Naming
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade introduces minor changes to the OpenStack VM naming convention to make Heat-generated names more user-friendly.

li.p: For a static resource, launched VM instances are named using the name attribute of the OS::Nova::Server structure (without including the <StackTemplateName>).

section.title: Enhanced Support for Server Groups
section.p: You can specify a maximum group size and a best-effort attribute for Server Groups.
The syntax for adding a Server Group Resource is as follows:
section.codeblock: ... resources: ... my_server_group: type: OS::Nova::ServerGroup properties: policy: 'anti-affinity' wrs-sg:group_size: 4 wrs-sg:best_effort: False ...

section.title: Relaxed Requirements for Passing User Data
section.p: The property UserDataType is a HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade template extension that you can use to pass user data to an instance even if the instance does not have cloud-init installed. For more information, see .

section.title: Improved User Access to Stacks
section.p: Stacks can be created, modified, or deleted by admin or non-admin users.

section.title: Greater Control over Resource Allocations
section.p: When creating a network resource using OS::Neutron::Net, you can use a depends_on attribute to ensure that the requirements of other resources are given priority before the resource is created. The attribute takes another resource as an argument. In the following example, it is used to specify that the resource external_network must be created before internal_network is created.

section.title: Support for Local Files in Glance Image
section.p: Support is added for specifying a local file or web URL as the location of a Glance image.
section.codeblock: ... wrl5_Glance_Image: type: OS::Glance::Image properties: name: {get_param: IMAGE_NAME } is_public: true container_format : bare disk_format : qcow2 location: file:///home/wrsroot/images/cgcs-guest.img ...

section.title: Support for name Property in Nova Flavor
section.p: A name property is added to the Flavor resource to support user-friendly names for Heat-generated flavors.

section.title: Additional Heat Resources
section.p: In addition to the standard OpenStack resources available for Heat templates, you can use the following resources:

Defines a packet scheduling weight that can be referenced by a tenant network (OS::Neutron::Net).
